title: unusable first firefox window but next is OK
content:
When I click the Firefox icon on my taskbar, it apparently starts OK, but in a second or so the window dims (See first attached image). This window doesn't allow any typed input anywhere, and doesn't close when I click the X in the upper left. This window can be made to go away either by using the Task Manager or by right-clicking on the taskbar icon and selecting Close Window.

However, if I right-click the taskbar icon and select Open New Window, the resulting window appears undimmed (Second attached image) and works correctly.

The above behavior is new; I've used Firefox for years with no problem.

The other user on this machine doesn't see this behavior at all.

title: Windows 10: Firefox updates whenever it wants to and deletes Stylus themes.
content:
Every damn time Firefox decides to update, it deletes every single one of my Stylus themes. And yet long standing issues like the Bookmark Tool Bar going blank if you watch video in full screen for too long still exist (10+ years now).

Also, whenever Firefox updates, it royally screws up the session that was active. Instead of opening every window and tab that was open, most of the time only one window gets restored. Sometimes none of the windows get restored because Firefox stupidly opens and then closes again, and then when it opens again, all you get is a page telling you about the stupid feature you don't care about that Firefox updated and ruined everything for.

title: CORS Error on many websites
content:
There are many sites that refue to load correctly. Soundcloud does not load at all and assets from Canva's stock media library only load the alt text descriptions. Both show that the culprit is the cross origin requests being blocked. I have reset Firefox to factory settings, uninstalled plugins, disabled enhanced tracking prevention, etc and tested private browsing which sometimes works but seems to be inconsistent. Any guess on why Firefox would be blocking Cross-Origin Requests? These sites have worked with Firefox in the past and work on Safari on the same Mac.

Canva: Cross-Origin Request Blocked: The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at https://media-public.canva.com/KH7y4/MAEGv3KH7y4/1/tl.png. (Reason: CORS request did not succeed). Status code: (null)

Soundcloud: Failed to load ‘https://a-v2.sndcdn.com/assets/2-517dcb44.js’. A ServiceWorker passed a promise to FetchEvent.respondWith() that resolved with non-Response value ‘undefined’. service-worker.js:1:2774

Cross-Origin Request Blocked: The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at https://a-v2.sndcdn.com/assets/2-517dcb44.js. (Reason: CORS request did not succeed). Status code: (null).

content:
I have an M1 Macbook Pro running macOS 15.5 (24F74). Often after booting up my laptop when Firefox launches it freezes. When I long press on the Firefox icon it says "Application is not responding".

I found this post: https://www.reddit.com/r/firefox/comments/1fi4p94/firefox_freezing_on_start_on_macos/ which mentions an incompatibility with Firefox and Adobe Creative Cloud. Sure enough, when I quit Creative Cloud Firefox starts successfully.

Anyone have any ideas of what's causing this?

title: When Firefox is updated (without my request) on a Mac desktop it does not restore windows on spaces other than the active one. This is expremely irritating, I do take measures in anticipation but updating could be less distructive.
content:
1. For a start you might do what you implicitly claim - restore open windows on all screen "spaces".

2. But recognising that you have never done this (& I have used Firefox on Macs for a long time) perhaps you could be honest and warn us both before and after a reboot.

(If there is a power outage or apple reboot, an apple "app" tends to be reopened, not usually on my preferred space. Other apps & processes are mostly not reloaded or restarted (another irritation), Firefox is somewhere in between.

3. I do of course take various measures to avoid time in reinstating "where was I", (so I bookmark all regular tabs on each space that I use for a particular type of activity, eg space 4 is booking regular sport-like venues, with a weather check tab too), but perhaps the whizz kids at mozilla, could think about how to help slow old guys like me recover from unexpected distractions & outages, etc.

title: Popover/modal elements not rendering correctly
content:
I'm using the latest stable version of Firefox (143.0.1 (aarch64)) on MacOS Tahoe and have been experiencing issues with these pop up elements not rendering correctly. Things like Facebook's Notifications dropdown or editing spreadsheets in Google Sheets, etc.

The element will only partially render, with some of the content clipped or hidden, almost like a z-index handling issue. Refreshing the page does. not fix the issue. The only way to see the content is to re-size the full browser window, forcing the browser to re-paint the page.

Same issue does not happen using Safari or Chrome that I've noticed.

I've tried reducing protections, disabling all extensions, clearing history & cache, etc.. I also fully re-installed Firefox (going from the Beta channel back to stable releases).

Anyone else experiencing this?

title: Firefox does not honor tab navigation sequence in PDF files with forms
content:
I'm testing a PDF file from the Brazilian Post Office for declaring the contents of shipped goods. I added the form to the official document to streamline some processes, for example, by avoiding having to enter the same data in the second block, as the data is replicated from the first. The form has an intuitive navigation sequence, so that the sender and recipient data are entered, all the sender fields are entered, and then the recipient fields are entered, followed by the shipped goods fields, as shown in the attached image (pdfscr.png). The problem is that Firefox alone doesn't recognize the tabbed navigation order, instead using line-level navigation (pdfscr2.png).

It's really annoying having to manipulate the PDF in Firefox because of this implementation flaw. Another point to note: The form fields are also formatted in the "Century Gothic" font, but in Firefox, they display in the default font and only appear correctly when printing. It could display the correct font during editing, as in all other browsers and programs.

Thank you for your attention.

title: 1st Firefox search from address bar ends on a SE homepage, not on search results
content:
Version/OS: It happens across multiple Firefox versions, currently 140.3.1esr (64-bit) I should not use latest version because it is not recommended. On my Debian Linux 13 i recommended to install packages from a stable repository.

Issue: when i type some phrase into address bar to search for it, it opens a search engine homepage https://searx.rhscz.eu not search results page. I have added the SE to FF by visiting its search page, click address bar, empty it, click drop-down menu, select currently opened SE.

When I try the same search process using address bar for the second time and onward, then it opens search results page correctly. I think that this issue happens only on 1st search attempt since browser start.
creator: lkeewp

title: Win 7prof. 64 bit + Firefox  115.28.0 Firefox ESR  September 16, 2025: Don't play audio file FLAC.
content:
With the latest update, I can no longer listen to the FLAC files on this site. Before, everything worked fine. When I try to listen with https[:] //audiophile [.] fm , it always says: "The audio format is not supported by your browser." I can listen to the same URLs of internet radios that broadcast FLAC files very well in VLC on the same computer, but not in Firefox.

Sorry for my English, I used a translator to help me.

Roberto D. - Italy
creator: robdario.tv

title: sidebar and toolbar customizations missing
content:
this update is NOT my favorite too many things are missing or are revamped into something i do not like. for instance. i HATE the way the sidebar is compressed to the side, then takes up valuable space with NONSENSE that i do not want. the toolbar - HOLY CRAPOLA!! i hate the new toolbar. i want the old tool bar and side bar back. there is SOOOO MUCH about the new toolbar that i hate that i simply can not begin to express where to start.

after so many years using firefox and recommending it to my customers - ill have to look for another browser to use and recommend to others.. i hate this!!!!!!!!!

title: The new tab holder at the top of the open tab list just zorched all my open tabs
content:
I'm stunned. I decided to try the "tab holder" feature that just appeared at the top of my sidebar with open tabs. I don't know why, but the tab holder went away, and with it the entire sidebar went blank. All my open tabs, my visual memory bank of places I frequent, just vanished.

I'm sick. Totally disabled by this.

Is there a place where newly added features are discussed, with instructions, etc.?

And how can I get my old sidebar list of tabs to come back?
creator: chelleemartin

title: Firefox can’t run Google Sheets button scripts, works fine on Chromium browsers
content:
I’m having an issue when using Google Sheets in Firefox. When I create a drawing shape, turn it into a button, and assign a script to it, everything works perfectly on Chromium-based browsers (Chrome, Edge, etc). But on Firefox, clicking the button just gives me:

> An error occurred > Script function xxx could not be found

Running the script from the custom menu (via `onOpen`) works without problems.

Some things I’ve tried / confirmed:

  • No execution log is recorded in GAS when the button is clicked.
  • Nothing shows up in the browser console either.
  • Turning off Enhanced Tracking Protection → still broken.
  • Disabling all extensions → still broken.
  • Troubleshooting mode → still broken.
  • Happens on my friend’s Firefox as well.
  • Happens on completely different spreadsheets as well.

So it seems like a consistent issue in Firefox itself. Has anyone run into this or know the cause?
creator: petounv877

title: Hotkey to Open All Playing PiP / Audio Media
content:
It would be extremely useful to have a single hotkey to open all currently playing videos or audio in Picture-in-Picture (PiP) mode in Firefox.

Currently, opening each video manually is time-consuming if multiple media are playing across tabs. A dedicated hotkey would:

Save time for users managing multiple media.

Improve multitasking and media consumption workflow.

Enhance accessibility for keyboard shortcut users.

Suggested Hotkey: Ctrl + Alt + P (P = PiP, easy to remember, low conflict with other shortcuts)

Optional: Support toggling all PiP windows on/off with the same shortcut could further streamline the experience.
creator: tantai1001test
